_comment: DO NOT EDIT: FILE GENERATED AUTOMATICALLY BY PTERODACTYL PANEL - PTERODACTYL.IO
name: itzg forge
author: energypatrikhu@proton.me

variables.name: TYPE
variables.description: The server type

variables.name: VERSION
variables.description: The Minecraft version to use.

variables.name: FORGE_VERSION
variables.description: The Forge version to use.

variables.name: CURSEFORGE_FILES
variables.description: CurseForge mods to install, separated by comma. Example: modID:version,modID:version (version is optional)

variables.name: MODRINTH_PROJECTS
variables.description: Modrinth projects to install, separated by comma. Example: fabric-api,cloth-config-fabric

variables.name: MODRINTH_DOWNLOAD_DEPENDENCIES
variables.description: Can be set to none, required, or optional to download required and/or optional dependencies.

variables.name: MODRINTH_PROJECTS_DEFAULT_VERSION_TYPE
variables.description: The version type is used to determine the newest version to use from each project. The allowed values are release (default), beta, alpha. Setting to beta will pick up both release and beta versions. Setting to alpha will pick up release, beta, and alpha versions.

variables.name: MEMORY
variables.description: The image declares an initial and maximum Java memory-heap limit.

variables.name: JVM_OPTS
variables.description: General JVM options can be passed to the Minecraft Server invocation by passing a JVM_OPTS environment variable. The JVM requires -XX options to precede -X options, so those can be declared in JVM_XX_OPTS. Both variables are space-delimited, raw JVM arguments

variables.name: JVM_XX_OPTS
variables.description: General JVM options can be passed to the Minecraft Server invocation by passing a JVM_OPTS environment variable. The JVM requires -XX options to precede -X options, so those can be declared in JVM_XX_OPTS. Both variables are space-delimited, raw JVM arguments

variables.name: JVM_DD_OPTS
variables.description: As a shorthand for passing several system properties as -D arguments, you can instead pass a comma separated list of name=value or name:value pairs with JVM_DD_OPTS. (The colon syntax is provided for management platforms like Plesk that don't allow = inside a value.)

variables.name: EXTRA_ARGS
variables.description: Arguments that would usually be passed to the jar file (those which are written after the filename)

variables.name: ENABLE_WHITELIST
variables.description: If managing the whitelist file manually, ENABLE_WHITELIST can be set to "true" to set the white-list property.

variables.name: ENFORCE_WHITELIST
variables.description: To enforce the whitelist changes immediately when whitelist commands are used , set ENFORCE_WHITELIST to "true".

variables.name: WHITELIST
variables.description: A list of usernames and/or UUIDs separated by comma to be whitelisted if ENABLE_WHITELIST is set to true

variables.name: OPS
variables.description: A list of usernames and/or UUIDs separated by comma to be added as server operators

variables.name: LOG_TIMESTAMP
variables.description: To include the timestamp with each log set to true

variables.name: EULA
variables.description: EULA

variables.name: STOP_SERVER_ANNOUNCE_DELAY
variables.description: To allow time for players to finish what they're doing during a graceful server shutdown, set STOP_SERVER_ANNOUNCE_DELAY to a number of seconds to delay after an announcement is posted by the server.

variables.name: STOP_DURATION
variables.description: When the container is signalled to stop, the Minecraft process wrapper will attempt to send a "stop" command via RCON or console and waits for the process to gracefully finish.

variables.name: CF_API_KEY
variables.description: CurseForge (Eternal) API Key.

variables.name: LOG_IPS
variables.description: Log player IP addresses.

variables.name: ENABLE_ROLLING_LOGS
variables.description: Enable rolling logs to avoid large log files.

variables.name: EXEC_DIRECTLY
variables.description: Execute the server directly instead of through a wrapper.

variables.name: GUI
variables.description: Enable or disable the graphical user interface.

variables.name: ACCEPTS_TRANSFERS
variables.description: Whether the server accepts transfers from other servers.

variables.name: ALLOW_FLIGHT
variables.description: Allows users to use flight mode if they have a speed modifier installed.

variables.name: ALLOW_NETHER
variables.description: Allows players to travel to the Nether.

variables.name: BROADCAST_CONSOLE_TO_OPS
variables.description: Broadcast console messages to ops.

variables.name: BROADCAST_RCON_TO_OPS
variables.description: Broadcast RCON messages to ops.

variables.name: BUG_REPORT_LINK
variables.description: The URL to which the player is taken if they click the bug report button in the pause menu.

variables.name: DIFFICULTY
variables.description: The difficulty level. Available values: peaceful,easy,normal,hard

variables.name: ENABLE_COMMAND_BLOCK
variables.description: Enable the command block.

variables.name: ENABLE_STATUS
variables.description: Enables the server status shown in the server list.

variables.name: ENFORCE_SECURE_PROFILE
variables.description: Enforce secure player profile.

variables.name: ENTITY_BROADCAST_RANGE_PERCENTAGE
variables.description: Entity broadcast range percentage.

variables.name: FORCE_GAMEMODE
variables.description: Force players to join in the default game mode.

variables.name: FUNCTION_PERMISSION_LEVEL
variables.description: Function permission level.

variables.name: GENERATE_STRUCTURES
variables.description: Defines whether structures (such as villages) will be generated.

variables.name: GENERATOR_SETTINGS
variables.description: Generator settings for custom worlds.

variables.name: HARDCORE
variables.description: If set to true, players will be set to spectator mode if they die.

variables.name: HIDE_ONLINE_PLAYERS
variables.description: Hide the online players from the server list.

variables.name: ICON
variables.description: The server icon URL.

variables.name: LEVEL
variables.description: Maps to [the `level-name` server property](https://minecraft.wiki/w/Server.properties#level-name). You can either switch between world saves or run multiple containers with different saves by using the LEVEL option

variables.name: LEVEL_TYPE
variables.description: Determines the world type to be generated.

variables.name: MAX_CHAINED_NEIGHBOR_UPDATES
variables.description: Limits the maximum number of rapid block updates without physics to prevent lag.

variables.name: MAX_PLAYERS
variables.description: The maximum number of players that can play on the server at the same time.

variables.name: MAX_TICK_TIME
variables.description: Sets the maximum number of milliseconds a single tick may take before the server watchdog stops the server with a crash.

variables.name: MAX_WORLD_SIZE
variables.description: This sets the maximum possible size in blocks, expressed as a radius, that the world border can obtain.

variables.name: MODE
variables.description: The default game mode for new players.

variables.name: MOTD
variables.description: Set the server log in message.

variables.name: NETWORK_COMPRESSION_THRESHOLD
variables.description: By default allows packet compression for packets larger than 256 bytes.

variables.name: ONLINE_MODE
variables.description: Server checks connecting players against Minecraft's account database.

variables.name: OP_PERMISSION_LEVEL
variables.description: Sets the default permission level for operators.

variables.name: OVERRIDE_ICON
variables.description: Override the server icon.

variables.name: PAUSE_WHEN_EMPTY_SECONDS
variables.description: Stop the server when no players are connected for this many seconds.

variables.name: PLAYER_IDLE_TIMEOUT
variables.description: The idle timeout in minutes.

variables.name: PREVENT_PROXY_CONNECTIONS
variables.description: If set to true, the server will not allow players to connect via proxy servers.

variables.name: PVP
variables.description: Enable or disable player versus player combat

variables.name: RATE_LIMIT
variables.description: Sets the number of milliseconds between consecutive logins.

variables.name: REGION_FILE_COMPRESSION
variables.description: The type of compression used for region files.

variables.name: RESOURCE_PACK
variables.description: The URL to the resource pack.

variables.name: RESOURCE_PACK_ENFORCE
variables.description: Enforce the use of the resource pack on the client side.

variables.name: RESOURCE_PACK_ID
variables.description: The ID of the resource pack.

variables.name: RESOURCE_PACK_PROMPT
variables.description: Optional prompt message shown to players when they decline a resource pack.

variables.name: RESOURCE_PACK_SHA1
variables.description: The SHA1 hash of the resource pack file.

variables.name: SEED
variables.description: The seed to use for generating the world.

variables.name: SERVER_NAME
variables.description: The name of the server.

variables.name: SIMULATION_DISTANCE
variables.description: Sets the maximum distance from players that the server-side chunk simulation distance is based on.

variables.name: SNOOPER_ENABLED
variables.description: Allow the server to send snoop data regularly to the Mojang server.

variables.name: SPAWN_MONSTERS
variables.description: Determines if monsters will be spawned.

variables.name: SPAWN_PROTECTION
variables.description: Determines the side length of the square spawn protection area.

variables.name: STATUS_HEARTBEAT_INTERVAL
variables.description: Sets the interval in seconds between status heartbeats.

variables.name: SYNC_CHUNK_WRITES
variables.description: Enables synchronous chunk writes.

variables.name: USE_NATIVE_TRANSPORT
variables.description: Use native transport for the network.

variables.name: VIEW_DISTANCE
variables.description: Sets the default view distance for players.
